Blocked

"Mirror sends amounts" is set to prevent entering amounts in this app, because they will be overridden by amounts received from the mirror connection.

If this app doesn\'t receive amounts from a mirror connection, unset this option.

Location permission

Devices running Android 6 to 11 need location permission to find Sibionics sensors.

Previously Juggluco needed location permission to find the Bluetooth device address of FreeStyle Libre 2 sensors. Now Juggluco uses another way to get the device address on most devices and is location permission not necessary.

Juggluco still uses the old method on Android 6,7 and 7.1 and location permission is still needed for them.

NEARBY DEVICES permission

Juggluco needs NEARBY DEVICES permission to receive glucose values via Bluetooth from Freestyle Libre 2 and 3 sensors. If Juggluco receives these glucose values from Juggluco running on another phone or watch, Juggluco doesn’t need this permission.

To watches, Juggluco connects via the companion app of that watch, so that Juggluco itself doesn’t need this permission to connect to watches.

Notifications

Unless Juggluco is used with Freestyle Libre 0 sensors, Juggluco must remain active in the background to receive a glucose reading every minute either directly from the sensor via Bluetooth or via a network connection. To prevent apps from being killed by Android, Android requires apps to display a notification so users know the application is present in the background. The text “To connect with sensor” or “To exchange data” describes why Juggluco has to stay active in the background.

Juggluco also uses the notification to display the current glucose value and a change direction arrow.
